SEARCH
Package grafiosch.repository

Interface UDFMetadataGeneralJpaRepository

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<UDFMetadataGeneral>, org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<UDFMetadataGeneral>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, UDFDataJpaRepository.IUDFRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral>, UDFMetadataGeneralJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateDeleteWithUserIdJpaRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral>, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral>
public interface UDFMetadataGeneralJpaRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral,Integer>, UDFMetadataGeneralJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateDeleteWithUserIdJpaRepository<UDFMetadataGeneral>
JPA repository interface for UDFMetadataGeneral entities providing comprehensive data access operations for general user-defined field metadata. This repository manages metadata definitions for user-defined fields that can be applied to any entity type that supports general UDF functionality, as opposed to specialized UDF metadata for specific entity types like securities. The repository combines standard JPA CRUD operations with custom query methods and user-specific operations for managing general UDF metadata. It provides functionality for retrieving metadata by user scope, entity filtering, uniqueness validation, and user-based deletion operations to support multi-tenant user-defined field management. General UDF metadata applies to entities that don't require specialized metadata structures, making it suitable for extending most business entities with custom fields while maintaining proper data isolation and validation constraints.

    • countUiOrderAndDescription

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) UDFMetadataBase.UiOrderDescriptionCount countUiOrderAndDescription(int[] users, String entityName, int uiOrder, String description)
      Counts existing UDF metadata entries with matching UI order and description values for validation purposes. This method executes a native SQL query to efficiently check uniqueness constraints by counting how many UDF metadata entries already exist with the specified UI order or description within the given user scope and entity type.
      The query performs two separate count operations:
      1. Counts entries with the same UI order value for the specified users and entity
      2. Counts entries with the same description for the specified users and entity
      This information is used to enforce uniqueness constraints before creating or updating UDF metadata entries, ensuring that UI order values remain unique for proper field arrangement and descriptions remain unique within the user's scope.
      Parameters:
      users - array of user IDs to check within (typically includes the current user and system user ID 0)
      entityName - the name of the entity class for which to check UDF metadata uniqueness
      uiOrder - the UI order value to check for existing usage
      description - the description text to check for existing usage
      Returns:
      a UiOrderDescriptionCount object containing the count of existing entries with matching UI order and description values
